intro: Gomphandra flavicarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited gomphandra, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by yellow, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
